text:
If someone succeeds in provoking 
you, realize that your mind is complicit 
in the provocation.
author: Epictecus

text:
A gem cannot be polished without 
friction, nor a man perfected without 
trials.
author: Seneca

text:
The best revenge is not to be like 
your enemy.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text:
You can tell the character of every 
man when you see how he gives and 
receives praise.
author: Seneca

text:
How long are you going to wait before 
you demand the best for yourself?
author: Epictecus

text:
You become what you give your attention 
to.
author: Epictecus

text:
Use what talents you ossess - the woods
will be very silent if no birds sang
except those that sang best.
author: Henry van Dyke

text:
Experience is the comb life gives you 
after we are bald.
author: Belgian Proverb

text:
A ship in the harbor is safe, but that
 is not what ships are built for.
author: John Shedd
